entry.title: Certification as a Catalyst: How Minsait Drives SAP Excellence in Brazil
entry.content:
Our partner Minsait, a company of the Indra Group, has established itself as a benchmark in digital transformation and SAP operations in Brazil. In this exclusive interview, the company shares how its long-standing commitment to SAP certifications has shaped its strategy, strengthened customer trust, and positioned it uniquely in the market. From pioneering SAP BTP operations in Brazil to driving innovation with AI, sustainability, and data-driven solutions, Minsait explains how it helps customers unlock the full potential of the SAP ecosystem ‚Äî and what strategic priorities will guide the next chapter of its growth. We highly appreciate our enduring collaboration with Minsait and their openness in sharing valuable insights and experiences as a trusted SAP-certified operations partner.

 

Would you like to start by telling us about your company and the services MINSAIT offers?

Minsait, a company of the Indra Group, is a leader in new digital environments and disruptive technologies, with a global presence and strong operations in Brazil. Our portfolio covers everything from strategic consulting to the implementation and management of mission-critical solutions, with a focus on delivering tangible business results. We operate across the entire value chain, offering consulting, systems integration, custom development, cybersecurity, automation, artificial intelligence, and application management services.

In the SAP ecosystem, we support companies through end-to-end journeys ‚Äî from defining the strategy, implementing digital transformation projects, migrating to SAP S/4HANA, and operating complex environments, to leveraging innovations such as SAP BTP, AI, Industry 4.0, and sustainability.

 

Minsati joined the certification program for operations partner in 2010 - what was the deciding factor behind this decision?

From the beginning, we understood that SAP certification was not just a label, but a competitive differentiator to reinforce our customers‚Äô trust. By joining the program in 2010, our goal was to prove ‚Äî with SAP‚Äôs endorsement ‚Äî the quality and maturity of our SAP operations and support processes. The certification was also seen as a public commitment to global best practices, aligning our operations with the highest standards in the market.

To what extent has this certification been helpful in your marketing efforts and in your communication with customers?

The certification is a powerful tool in building credibility. In the sales process, it serves as concrete proof that we follow SAP-recognized standards and have proven capabilities to deliver high-quality services. It also differentiates Minsait in competitive bids and RFPs, strengthening our position as a trusted partner for strategic projects and mission-critical operations.

  

MINSAIT has recently received certification for SAP BTP operations in Brazil for the first time. What significance does SAP BTP hold for MINSAIT and its customers? And to what extent did the audit support your SAP BTP strategy?

SAP BTP is far more than a technical platform ‚Äî it is a central pillar of our digital transformation strategy for customers. It enables us to create extensions, intelligent integrations, automations, and advanced data and analytics solutions, enhancing the value of the SAP core while keeping it clean (clean core). In practice, this means transforming ERP systems into intelligent, scalable platforms ready for continuous innovation.

The importance of this achievement is even greater because Minsait is only the second company in Brazil to obtain the SAP BTP operations certification. This reinforces our position as a trusted partner frequently recommended to support customers in complex and strategic BTP projects. This trust is no coincidence ‚Äî it is the result of a solid track record of more than 180 SAP BTP developments and success stories, covering integration, automation, extension, and analytics scenarios for clients across various industries.

When combined with other high-profile certifications such as CMMI, TMMi, SAP BTP Operations, and SAP S/4HANA Solutions Operations, this achievement places Minsait in a unique position: we are the only Brazilian company with this set of certifications, demonstrating our unmatched strength in development quality, testing, and SAP operations management.

The audit played a key role in further strengthening our BTP strategy. It validated practices, highlighted our strengths, and pointed to areas for improvement ‚Äî such as test automation, observability, and standardization of operations across multiple environments. We have incorporated these recommendations into our roadmap, enabling us to further raise our maturity level and ensure every BTP delivery is a benchmark for quality and innovation in the market.

 

Minsait and SAP team at the audit in July 2025

 

SAP consistently aligns its strategy with the cloud and encourages partners to actively support customers during their migration journey. What distinguishes your company in this regard, and how do you support your customers in their digital transformation?

Our differentiator lies in the combination of experience, proximity to our customers‚Äô business, and multidisciplinary technical expertise. We work with agile methodologies, proprietary tools, and accelerators that reduce project time and migration risks. Furthermore, we don‚Äôt just migrate systems to the cloud ‚Äî we ensure that this move delivers real business value, integrating data, artificial intelligence, automation, and clean core practices.

This consultative, results-oriented approach enables us to accelerate SAP innovation adoption, ensuring that each customer gets the most from their cloud investment.

 

How do your SAP certifications reflect your strategy and position in the Brazilian market?

The achievement of SAP BTP Operations certification in Brazil, along with the renewal of our SAP S/4HANA Solutions Operations certification, is not just a technical milestone ‚Äî it is a symbol of our continuous evolution and the trust we have earned from SAP and our customers.

Since joining the certification program in 2010, our strategy has been clear: align our processes with the most demanding global standards while maintaining the agility and proximity required by the Brazilian market. Over the years, this approach has established us as a reference in SAP application management and the execution of high-complexity projects, always focusing on quality, security, and business results.

The fact that we are the only Brazilian company to hold certifications such as CMMI, TMMi, and the certifications for SAP BTP operations and SAP S/4HANA solutions Operations reinforces our robustness and organizational maturity. This allows us to consistently deliver value, whether in complex implementations, cloud migrations, critical integrations, or the ongoing management of mission-critical environments.

Our commitment for the coming years is to continue innovating, anticipating trends, and helping our customers get the most out of the SAP ecosystem ‚Äî always with the security of having a certified, experienced, and results-driven partner.

 

Looking ahead, what are your strategic priorities in your partnership with SAP? Are there specific areas within SAP‚Äôs portfolio ‚Äì such as AI, sustainability, industry cloud, or further expansion in SAP BTP ‚Äì where you see growth opportunities or plan to invest?

Our strategic priorities are focused on six major pillars:

First, we are expanding our SAP BTP expertise, using it as a platform for innovation, automation, and seamless data integration. We are also applying Artificial Intelligence directly to business processes, leveraging SAP AI Core and AI Hub capabilities as well as partnerships with leading technology providers. Sustainability and ESG are deeply embedded in our portfolio, with solutions that enable customers to measure, reduce, and report their environmental and social impact. At the same time, we support the responsible and fast adoption of SAP S/4HANA, ensuring that customers who have not yet migrated can make the transition securely and with clear added value. Another key focus is the Business Data Cloud (BDC), which reinforces our commitment to transforming our customers‚Äô data into strategic and monetizable assets. Finally, through Intelligent AMS, we combine advanced monitoring, automation, and predictive analytics to reduce incidents and maximize performance.

 

Information on the certification program for operations partners and an overview of all certified partners can be found in the SAP Operations Partner Guide.

Visit OPC at SAP.com

entry.title: Rework Process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (Process Manufacturing with Co-Products and Scrap
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I‚Äôm currently working on an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition implementation in the area of process manufacturing, and I would like to ask for your insights regarding the rework process.

Here is my scenario:

  • I produce a finished product (FG) using a BOM that includes co-products (products manufactured simultaneously with the FG) and scrap.

  • At the end of production, I decide that the finished product is not conforming.

  • I want to run a rework process, where:

    • The input is the nonconforming finished product.

    • The output is a conforming portion of the finished product, the co-product, and the associated scrap.

My question:
How can I model and execute this rework process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for process manufacturing (not discrete manufacturing)?

  • Are there standard steps I should follow?

  • Which Fiori apps should I use (for order creation, confirmation, rework , etc.)?

  • Is there a recommended best practice for managing this scenario (e.g., using a rework recipe, process order adjustments, or another approach)?

Any guidance, experience sharing, or references to official documentation would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your support!
